ovdesc.p: This application will allow the user to define an axis and its contents (Member field, defining the grouping of assets, e.g. stocks, bonds, cash) and list the elements belonging to each group at the asset or sub asset type level. These will be used to define the composition of a matrix.
MEMBER = North America, Europe, Asia, Other

desc.p: Member name that will appear on the heading of a grid comparison. This field is modified to allow the user to enter the member label in various languages. If blank, MEMBER is display.
Optional input
0 - 35 alphanumeric characters long free text.

Must be a valid member defined in the MEMBER field above

Multi-valued field used to define the different elements of the axis , i.e., the column or row headings of a grid.

The members are defined using the entities that have been created. When a user re-balances a portfolio each position in the portfolio will be assigned to a member by matching its characteristics with the characteristics defined in the entity and axis.

An entity is a term used to describe the ways we can look at instruments. It is the segment or cell of a matrix. e.g. an asset type, currency, modified duration, sector.

Total of this sub-valued field throughout each TO.MEMBER sub-valued field must be 100%
1 - 6 alphanumeric characters
Mandatory input
This field contains the allocation mode.

DIRECT means that the MEMBER field contains the actual modelling position code (usually the internal security code). If this is used, the position allocation is done directly to the corresponding member. You do not have to set up a rule for that member.
RULES or blank indicates that the allocation is done using rules describe with fields ENTITY, OPERAND, VALUE, TO.MEMBER, TO.PCT.
AUTOMATIC When an item is allocated to a MEMBER which has its MBR.ALLOCATION set as AUTOMATIC the MEMBER will be replaced with the entity value.
This allows for a dynamic member list, hence if the entity returns the currency we would dynamically generate member labels for each currency.
DIRECT type members are process before RULES.
DIRECT, RULES or AUTOMATIC
Optional input. Blank is processed as RULES.
